newsitem.title: ROMANIA: SOCCER-STEAUA PRESIDENT BANNED OVER TRANSFER ROW.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-STEAUA PRESIDENT BANNED OVER TRANSFER ROW.

text.p: Romania's soccer federation (FRF) on Wednesday banned Steaua Bucharest's president Marcel Puscas for a year over his accusations that the federation had illegally taken a percentage of payments for foreign transfers.
Federation deputy general secretary Cristian Bivolaru said Puscas had been barred from all activity in the sport for a year and fined more than $7000 for "libellous statements".
Puscas, appointed Steaua president four months ago, accused the FRF in a series of interviews of illegally taking 10 percent from each player's transfer money.
He alleged that the Federation took a similar cut from Steaua's games in the European Champions' League and said the system was in violation of FIFA and UEFA regulations.
Last week, Puscas said Steaua, currently second in the league, had paid out a total of $920,000 to the FRF.
The FRF said the practice was a normal one, with the funds being used to train junior players.

Eight first division teams have formally asked the FRF to return sums of money in connection with transfers abroad. A senior official of Universitatea Craiova last week said his club were seeking the return of $500,000.
